general_advisory: After pre-monsoon rainfall go for summer ploughing. Due to the overturning of the soil in summer ploughing the sharp rays of the sun enters the soil and kill the eggs, larvae, and pupae of soil-borne insects and pests, thereby the hazards of insects and pests on the subsequent crop is reduced.

advisory: Sesamum pod borer infestation may observed in some places, to control spray neem oil @ 5 ml/l or spinosad 45SC @ 0.2 ml/l or flubendiamide 480SC @ 0.3 ml/l or chlorantraniliprole 18.5SC @ 0.4 ml/l or quinalphos 25EC @ 2 ml/l or profenofos 50EC @ 2 ml/l.

For management of mango fruit borer spray Neem oil 3ml + chloripyriphos 1 ml per litre of water along with stickers at the marble stage of the fruit. The sprayings should be preferably carried out during evening hours.

Weather is favorable for fruit and vine rot of pointed gourd. Spray alternately Copper Oxychloride 50% WP @ 3 g/litre of water and Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% @ 2.5 g/litre of water in clear and dry weather.
Make proper drainage system to drain out excess of rain water.

Provide clean and sufficient drinking water with 50 gm of salts to the animals and keep them inside during the daytime. As the temperature is getting higher, bath animals 2 to 3 times a day. Keep wet gunny bags on windows and doors to control inside temperature.
Vaccinate animals as per the schedule, provide clean drinking water and keep the shed clean.
Don't keep a dense population on the farm. As it leads to an increase in temperature and death rate of chicks. Add vitamin C to food or water of poultry as it decreases dehydration in chicks.
